text: A Century of Wickets: The Story of Cricket
Humble Beginnings:  Cricket's origins are believed to be in 13th-century southeast England, a simple game played by boys using a tree stump and a sheep pen.
image_desc: Medieval children playing game with stick and ball clipart

text: 1744: The First Laws of Cricket were written by the Star and Garter Club, laying the foundation for the game's structure.
image_desc: Old book with quill pen and inkwell clipart

text: 1745: Women took to the crease! The first known women's cricket match was played in Surrey, showcasing the game's early inclusivity.
image_desc: Women playing cricket clipart, historical style

text: 1877: The First Test Match! Australia and England faced off in Melbourne, marking a pivotal moment in cricket's history.
image_desc: Australia vs England cricket match clipart, historical style

text: A Global Game: Cricket spread across the globe with the British Empire, captivating audiences in North America and beyond.
image_desc: World map with cricket bats and balls placed on various countries clipart

text: The 22-Yard Pitch:  A constant throughout history, the pitch length has remained unchanged, a testament to the game's enduring traditions.
India's Triumphs:  A nation's passion! India stands alone as the only country to win World Cups in all three formats: 60 overs, 50 overs, and 20 overs.
image_desc: Indian cricket team celebrating victory clipart

text: The IPL Phenomenon: The Indian Premier League is now the most-attended cricket league globally, a testament to the sport's enduring popularity.
image_desc: IPL logo and cheering crowd clipart

text: From humble beginnings to global phenomenon, cricket continues to unite and inspire millions worldwide.  The game's rich history and enduring spirit promise many more exciting chapters to come.
image_desc: Cricket players from diverse backgrounds playing together clipart
